A woman who was kidnapped and held captive for three weeks after leaving her northern California home to jog was found safe on the side of a rural road bound in restraints, a local sheriff said Friday.

(Shasta County Sheriff’s Office)  A Northern California woman who was apparently abducted earlier this month during a   jog was found Thanksgiving Day, when she was released by her captor on a rural road in Yolo County, authorities said.
